tasks.title: Dashboard Revamp: Requirements Analysis and Design
tasks.description: Analyze dashboard revamp requirements, including user needs for the hero section, 'My Library' (2/3), and cognitive profile (1/3), and design a viewport-based layout.
tasks.details:
1. Analyze the existing dashboard/page.tsx code to understand the current structure and identify potential conflicts.
2. Design a new layout structure based on user requirements and viewport considerations (Above the Fold 100vh).
3. Develop a component separation strategy to improve code reusability and maintainability.
4. Create a responsive design plan to ensure the dashboard adapts to various screen sizes.
5. Investigate performance optimization strategies to enhance the dashboard's loading speed and responsiveness.
6. Document potential error scenarios, such as dependency conflicts, and outline mitigation strategies, including phased refactoring.
7. Plan for component reusability to minimize code duplication and improve maintainability.

tasks.title: Implement Viewport-Based Dashboard Layout
tasks.description: Implement the new dashboard layout structure based on viewport dimensions, incorporating the hero section and the split 'My Library' and cognitive profile sections. This implementation reuses existing components and focuses on layout improvements.
tasks.details:
1. Modify `dashboard/page.tsx` to implement the new layout structure.
2. Reuse the existing `BooksPageContent.tsx` component for the 'My Library' section.
3. Reuse the existing `CognitiveProfileContainer.tsx` component for the cognitive profile section.
4. Use CSS Grid to create a 2/3 + 1/3 split layout for 'My Library' and the cognitive profile sections within the 'Above the Fold' area.
5. Implement viewport-based height calculation (100vh - header height) using `clamp()` and `min-height` in CSS to ensure proper sizing.
6. Add the Habitus33 button to the top-left corner of the hero section.
7. Implement responsive breakpoints to adjust the layout for desktop, tablet, and mobile devices. On mobile, switch to a vertical stack layout.
8. Integrate the cognitive profile component into its designated section.

tasks.title: Implement Responsive Design and Mobile Optimization
tasks.description: Implement responsive design and mobile optimization to ensure optimal layout and user experience across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.
tasks.details:
1. Apply Tailwind CSS responsive classes to adapt the layout for different screen sizes.
2. Optimize for mobile breakpoint (sm: 640px and below), converting the 2/3 + 1/3 layout to a vertical stack.
3. Ensure touch-friendly interfaces by applying appropriate button sizes (minimum 44px touch area).
4. Implement mobile-specific navigation patterns to minimize scrolling and improve accessibility.
5. Optimize performance by implementing image lazy loading and component code splitting.
6. Address potential mobile viewport height calculation errors by using CSS 100dvh and considering iOS Safari compatibility.
7. Prevent touch gesture conflicts by clearly separating scroll and button areas.
8. Implement a mobile-first approach, ensuring core functionality is accessible and performant on mobile devices.
9. Apply specific CSS rules to handle layout changes, font sizes, and spacing for mobile devices.
10. Implement a mobile-specific navigation bar or tab bar for easy access to key features.

tasks.title: Optimize Performance and Enhance User Experience
tasks.description: Optimize application performance and enhance user experience by improving page load times, component rendering, and asset delivery, while ensuring smooth animations and transitions.
tasks.details:
1. Implement React.memo and memoization hooks (useCallback, useMemo) to prevent unnecessary re-renders of components.
2. Optimize images by using WebP format and appropriate sizing, leveraging the Next.js Image component with priority settings.
3. Implement code splitting and lazy loading for components to reduce the initial bundle size.
4. Optimize CSS animations using CSS transforms and the `will-change` property to improve performance.
5. Analyze the bundle size using tools like `webpack-bundle-analyzer` and optimize it by removing unused code and dependencies.
6. Measure web vitals metrics (e.g., First Contentful Paint, Largest Contentful Paint, Cumulative Layout Shift) using tools like Lighthouse and the Chrome DevTools and implement improvements based on the results.
7. Implement a loading state for images and other slow-loading components to improve the user experience.
8. Refactor components to reduce complexity and improve rendering performance.
9. Implement caching strategies to reduce server load and improve response times.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Measure page load times and First Contentful Paint before and after optimization to quantify improvements.
2. Verify that components are not re-rendering unnecessarily by using the React Profiler.
3. Ensure that images are loading quickly and efficiently using the Next.js Image component.
4. Test animations and transitions on different devices and browsers to ensure smoothness.
5. Verify that the bundle size has been reduced after optimization.
6. Measure web vitals metrics before and after optimization to ensure improvements.
7. Test the application on different network conditions to ensure it performs well even on slow connections.
8. Use the Chrome DevTools to identify and fix any performance bottlenecks.

tasks.title: Dashboard Revamp Testing and Quality Assurance
tasks.description: Conduct thorough testing and quality assurance of the revamped dashboard, ensuring compatibility, functionality, accessibility, and performance across various browsers and devices.
tasks.details:
1. **Cross-Browser Compatibility Testing:** Perform compatibility testing on major browsers (Chrome, Safari, Firefox) to identify and resolve rendering differences.
2. **Functional Testing:** Execute functional tests to validate that all dashboard features operate as expected, including interactions between components and data display.
3. **User Scenario Validation:** Verify key user scenarios to ensure a seamless and intuitive user experience.
4. **Accessibility Testing:** Conduct accessibility testing using tools like axe-core to ensure compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards. Perform screen reader testing to validate usability for users with disabilities.
5. **Performance Testing:** Perform performance testing using Lighthouse to measure key metrics such as First Contentful Paint, Largest Contentful Paint, and Cumulative Layout Shift. Conduct load testing to assess the dashboard's performance under high traffic conditions.
6. **Unit and E2E Testing:** Implement Jest and React Testing Library for unit tests and Playwright or Cypress for end-to-end (E2E) tests to ensure code quality and reliability.
7. **Device Testing:** Test the dashboard on a variety of devices (desktops, tablets, smartphones) to ensure responsiveness and optimal display.
8. **User Feedback Collection:** Gather user feedback on the revamped dashboard to identify areas for improvement and address any usability issues.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. **Browser Compatibility:** Verify that the dashboard renders correctly and functions as expected on Chrome, Safari, and Firefox. Document and address any rendering differences.
2. **Functional Validation:** Confirm that all dashboard features (e.g., data display, button clicks, form submissions) operate correctly and produce the expected results.
3. **Accessibility Compliance:** Use axe-core to identify and fix accessibility issues, ensuring compliance with WCAG 2.1 AA standards. Verify that the dashboard is usable with screen readers.
4. **Performance Metrics:** Measure page load times and Core Web Vitals (e.g., First Contentful Paint, Largest Contentful Paint) using Lighthouse. Ensure that performance meets or exceeds established goals.
5. **Responsive Design:** Verify that the dashboard layout adapts correctly across different screen sizes and devices (desktop, tablet, mobile).
6. **User Feedback Integration:** Collect and analyze user feedback to identify areas for improvement. Implement necessary changes to address usability issues and enhance the user experience.
7. **Automated Testing:** Run Jest unit tests and Playwright/Cypress E2E tests to ensure code quality and prevent regressions.

tasks.title: Dashboard Revamp Deployment and Performance Monitoring
tasks.description: Deploy the revamped dashboard to staging and production environments, set up real-time monitoring, and establish a user feedback collection system.
tasks.details:
1. Deploy the application to Vercel staging environment for final validation.
2. Deploy the application to Vercel production environment.
3. Configure Google Analytics to track user behavior and gather insights.
4. Set up error monitoring using Sentry to capture and address runtime issues.
5. Build a performance monitoring dashboard to track key metrics.
6. Prepare for A/B testing and implement a gradual rollout strategy.
7. Establish a user feedback channel to collect and analyze user input.
8. Implement canary deployment for production to minimize impact of potential issues.
9. Set up automated alerts for performance degradation and errors.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify successful deployment to both staging and production environments.
2. Confirm that Google Analytics is correctly tracking user behavior.
3. Ensure that Sentry is capturing and reporting errors effectively.
4. Validate the functionality of the performance monitoring dashboard.
5. Test the A/B testing setup and rollout process.
6. Confirm the user feedback channel is functioning correctly and feedback is being collected.
7. Monitor performance metrics (page load times, error rates) in production after deployment.
8. Verify that alerts are triggered when performance thresholds are exceeded.
